required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy (PNT) With Chronic Low Back Pain Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy With Chronic Low Back Pain Patients With or Without Lower Extremity Pain - A Randomized, Controlled, Parallel Groups Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the benefits of Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy when compared to a reference sham treatment in the treatment of patients who have undergone surgical intervention for chronic low back pain with or without a radiating lower extremity pain component.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Slow recruitment and high dropout rates

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Time-Averaged Pain Intensity Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time-averaged from the first available observation to the last available observation (12 months for completed subjects)

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Expenditure Per Day on All Lower Back Pain Related Interventions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 01, Month 02, Month 04, Month 06, Month 08, Month 10, Month 12

intervention.description: Ten PNT sessions in eleven weeks On average, one PNT session per week Ten lumbar Safeguide electrodes (three centimeters in length) deployed per lumbar montage Forty-five minutes of electrical stimulation for each session Electrical stimulation parameters: Continuous 50 Hz current Charge-balanced, biphasic (each phase is 200 microsec), rectangular waveform Intensity to subject's tolerance for ten minutes then increased to a mildly uncomfortable level

Ten TENS sessions in eleven weeks On average, one TENS session per week Four 2-inch (5.1 centimeters) diameter pads applied per TENS lumbar montage Forty-five minutes of electrical stimulation for each session Electrical stimulation parameters: Current at 2 Hzâ€”low frequency Pulse trains delivered as asymmetric, biphasic, square waveform current, with pulse width lasting 20 microsec Intensity titrated according to subject's sensory threshold To maintain blinding, the treating physician or clinician will check on the subject after 10 minutes and dial the channels down just prior to the point of turning off the device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Low back pain for at least 6 months
- If lower extremity pain present, must be present for at least 3 months
- Visual analog scale (VAS) score for low back pain at least 50 out of 100
- Lumbar or lumbosacral surgical intervention without pain relief
- Central sensitization symptoms
- Agrees to follow randomized treatment plan
- 18 years of age or older
- Signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant change to low back or lower extremity pain within 4 weeks prior to enrollment
- Nociceptive and/or neuropathic pain symptoms in the spine due to structural and/or mechanical instabilities
- Three or more lumbar or lumbosacral surgical interventions; one or more surgical interventions in areas other than lumbar or lumbosacral spine
- Three or more lumbar vertebral segments fused
- Lumbar or lumbosacral surgical intervention in last 9 months; areas other than lumbar or lumbosacral in last 12 months
- Any additional surgical intervention required 3 months post-enrollment
- Symptoms consistent with sympathetically-maintained pain
- Evidence of serious neurological deficits or impairments
- Significant changes in pain medications within 4 weeks prior to enrollment
- Psychosocial issues that conflict with valid reporting by patient
- Prior treatment with percutaneous electrical stimulation or sensitivity to electrical stimulation
- Current use of another electrical stimulation device for low back or lower extremity pain
- Current enrollment in another clinical trial within the last 30 days
- Current or prior malignancy or cancer
- Serious or uncontrolled systemic illness
- Body mass index (BMI) greater than 40
- Pregnant or intends to become pregnant during the study
- Implanted medical device
- Relationship with study staff
- Unable to attend study office visits or complete study measures

facility.name: Neuropsychiatric Pain Medicine Association of Tennessee

reference.citation: White PF, Ghoname EA, Ahmed HE, Hamza MA, Craig WF, Vakharia AS. The effect of montage on the analgesic response to percutaneous neuromodulation therapy. Anesth Analg. 2001 Feb;92(2):483-7.

Ghoname ES, Craig WF, White PF, Ahmed HE, Hamza MA, Gajraj NM, Vakharia AS, Noe CE. The effect of stimulus frequency on the analgesic response to percutaneous electrical nerve stimulation in patients with chronic low back pain. Anesth Analg. 1999 Apr;88(4):841-6.

White PF, Craig WF, Vakharia AS, Ghoname E, Ahmed HE, Hamza MA. Percutaneous neuromodulation therapy: does the location of electrical stimulation effect the acute analgesic response? Anesth Analg. 2000 Oct;91(4):949-54.
Seroussi RE, Gliner BE, et. al. Effectiveness of Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy for Patients with Chronic and Severe Low Back Pain. Pain Practice 3(1) 22-30, 2003

Borg-Stein J, Seroussi RE, Gomba L, Meleger A, Schmitt S, Leep E, Glassman JH, Revord J, Condon J, Bensen E, Fitzthum JE, Fowler BC, Gliner BE, Firlik AD. Safety and efficacy of percutaneous neuromodulation therapy in the management of subacute radiating low back pain. Pain Pract. 2003 Jun;3(2):125-34.

responsible_party.name_title: Vice President of Research and Development

group.title: Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy (PNT)
group.description: Active/test group receiving 10 Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy (PNT) sessions of 45 minutes each over 11 weeks. PNT delivers 50 Hz current in a charge-balanced, biphasic, rectangular waveform.

group.title: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS)
group.description: Sham comparator group receiving 10 TENS sessions of 45 minutes each over 11 weeks. Delivered 2 Hz pulse trains as asymmetric, biphasic, square waves with pulse width of 20 microseconds.

participants_list.participants: One subject had an invalid birth date and was excluded from the Age Categorical counts.

group.title: Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy (PNT)
group.description: Active/test group receiving 10 Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy (PNT) sessions of 45 minutes each over 11 weeks. PNT delivers 50 Hz current in a charge-balanced, biphasic, rectangular waveform.

group.title: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS)
group.description: Sham comparator group receiving 10 TENS sessions of 45 minutes each over 11 weeks. Delivered 2 Hz pulse trains as asymmetric, biphasic, square waves with pulse width of 20 microseconds.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: One subject had an invalid birth date and was excluded from the Age Categorical counts.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Time-averaged Pain Intensity Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Score
outcome.description: Visual analog scale (VAS) for pain (100mm line with "0/No pain" on the left and "100/Worst pain imaginable" on the right). Subjects drew vertical line to indicate pain. Time-averaged method accounts for time between visits by dividing area beneath the score curve by time between first and last available visits.
outcome.time_frame: Time-averaged from the first available observation to the last available observation (12 months for completed subjects)
outcome.population: Analysis population was intention to treat (ITT), excluding subjects who had no follow-up (after the initial 10-week treatment phase) data available.

group.title: Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy (PNT)
group.description: Active/test group receiving 10 Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy (PNT) sessions of 45 minutes each over 11 weeks. PNT delivers 50 Hz current in a charge-balanced, biphasic, rectangular waveform.

group.title: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS)
group.description: Sham comparator group receiving 10 TENS sessions of 45 minutes each over 11 weeks. Delivered 2 Hz pulse trains as asymmetric, biphasic, square waves with pulse width of 20 microseconds.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Time-averaged Pain Intensity Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Score
measure.description: Visual analog scale (VAS) for pain (100mm line with "0/No pain" on the left and "100/Worst pain imaginable" on the right). Subjects drew vertical line to indicate pain. Time-averaged method accounts for time between visits by dividing area beneath the score curve by time between first and last available visits.
measure.population: Analysis population was intention to treat (ITT), excluding subjects who had no follow-up (after the initial 10-week treatment phase) data available.

outcome.title: Total Expenditure Per Day on All Lower Back Pain Related Interventions
outcome.description: Expenditures were assessed by patient report at each visit. Interventions were coded to Current Procedural Terminology (CPT) 2008; costs were derived from Medicare, Managed Care, and Workersâ€™ Comp fees. Costs for providers assume 30 minutes at returning patient rate. Drug costs were coded to a dictionary extrapolated from 2008 market prices.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 01, Month 02, Month 04, Month 06, Month 08, Month 10, Month 12
outcome.population: Analysis population was intention to treat (ITT).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If the PI expects to participate in the publication or presentation of data generated in the performance of the study, any reports, abstracts, manuscripts, or other presentation materials shall be submitted to the sponsor for review prior to submission for publication or presentation. The sponsor shall have 30 calendar days to respond with any requested revisions in order to protect the sponsor's confidential information.
